flawed_nl_solution:
If there are 600 people at the fair this year, the number going to the fair next year is 2*600 = <<2*600=2100>>2100.
The number of people at the fair this year and the ones going next year totals 2100+600 = <<2100+600=2700>>2700
The number of people who went to that fair last year was 200 less than those going next year, meaning there were 2100-200 = 1900 people at the fair last year.
In the three years, the number of people at the fair will be 2700 of this and next year + 1900 of last year = <<2700+1900=4600>>4600
#### 4600

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 2100. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
